bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, April 20, 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Fine weather here & Warry thinks I ought to get out doors, even if — & I may if it is not noon yet — Nothing very new or different — (of course I skip all the many bad points & botherings as you have plenty enough y'ryour own) — Lou was here Saturday —all well as usual— my 2nd annex proofs are substantially done wh'which is a g'tgreat triumph & relief—Dearest Han, I will send you one as soon as I get— I am sitting here alone expecting the doctor—$2 enclosed—
